Reviews.Title: “Great, just what was needed”
Reviews.Author: Liz R
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the hotel, it was clean, comfortable and had plenty of space in my room and a good sized bathroom too. If I didn't know that the Senator hotel at 21 Gran Via was closer to the Gran Via metro I would have been even more pleased with the location. We made the most of being in the midst of some great shops etc and found some nice local places to eat nearby too. The staff were really helpful and friendly. I'd recommend it to anyone, but check out the one at number 70 if you don't want to walk quite so far to public transport as it is right by a metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Clean but tiny rooms.”
Reviews.Author: 198JenSmith
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for a weekend after spending the majority of our summer in Northern Spain. This hotel has great staff who speak many languages. They understood English and gave us perfect directions to tourist spots around town. The rooms were a little 'tight' so to speak. We had double beds which was two beds literally touching with no space between. We had just enough walking room around the beds circumference wise. LOL! Which after a day of site seeing and partying all night this didnt really matter. This hotel is on a main street which has many shopping stores and close to many major tourists sites and restaurants. Whether your searching for a delicious Bocadillo in a tapas bar or craving TGIFridays or Starbucks you will find it within walking distance from this hotel. Note as in any country be aware of your surroundings many many pick pocketers. While sitting at the hotel lobby bar a woman had her purse taken off the back of her chair. Although this was disappointing to witness I would 100% stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: SimonOF
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located for a weekend city break in Madrid. The rooms are a touch out of date but spacious and clean. The staff were friendly and obliging. A bit surprised the guests had to pay to use the spa but wasn't very much. We made use of the jacuzzi on the rooftop which was excellent, particularly when it was over 100 degrees. The sun loungers could have done with some cushions as trying to lie out on a wooden sun lounger is a bit uncomfortable. Breakfast was plentiful and there was lots of choice. Wouldn't hesitate in recommending the hotel to others for a cheap, clean, well equiped hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: graytowse
Reviews.Content: Situated on the main shopping street and a short walk to a wide range of attractions, bars and restaurants. Staff were very helpful and spoke good English. Room really big and spacious. Bed very comfortable. Water and cola in the minibar were free and there were tea and coffee making facilities in the room. It was pretty hot when we stayed (40 +) and air conditioning effective There is a bar within the hotel and again barman spoke English and was very helpful. Enjoyed the hot tubs on the roof but did not try the spa. It is one of the nicest rooms we have had in a capital city and will hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location but should be more luxurious for 4****”
Reviews.Author: Roby1948
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May for 4 nights with friends visiting from Scotland. Location was great but a little disappointed in the rooms and public areas. We found the reception and bar staff friendly, helpful and courteous. Breakfast was a bit hit and miss when busy - even ran out of coffee one morning - and replacement trays of food very slow in coming. OK if you went to breakfast early but wait to 08.45 and the staff seemed to disappear. Overall fair value but definitely needs a bit more comfort.

Reviews.Title: “This should be a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joyvdp
Reviews.Content: Best : The location ! Good: Spa , spacious room & bathroom Average: Staff Bad: very warm in our room, needs some cleaning & claiming to be 4 star hotel but has 3 star quality

Reviews.Title: “Location is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: QuintanaTravel
Reviews.Content: Was here for the conference and this location proved to be a winner. Close to metro (plaza espagna), on the main street (gran Via) close to everything so i realy enjoyed it. Sleeped Like a log :) and rooms are very nice but as i've said i didn't spent much time in it :) i noticed that rarely rooms have main street view but maybe that is not such a loss since Madrid streets are full with life and therefore noise but I don't know. Only thing i didn't Like was that slow wireless (was it 'kobi'?). I realy can't find one good reason ehy in 4 star hotel you can open YouTube movie on Your comp. Liked friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and staff could not do enough for you. We were very pleased with our accommodation and the facilities at our disposal. My friend became ill and the hotel was very helpful and allowed us to stay past the check out time. I would be happy to stay here again and i would recommend it to others. It was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Kimberley P
Reviews.Content: We started our Europe holiday in Madrid and have to say that we were a little underwhelmed by what we got in terms of the hotel. The service was nothing special with staff speaking little English and seeming underwhelmed by our arrival. The room was clean and tidy however the decor was a little dated. We had a room facing the city so all night we would hear sirens and drunks roaming the streets. The location is however very good with everything you need within walking distance. We didn't need to use public transport to see any of the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: annievde
Reviews.Content: Pictures on internet much nicer than reality, reception nice, no swimmingpool on the roof,only jacuzzi with cold water No pillow on the sofa at the terras, and very poor Rooms are clean, but not really nice I wont go back there

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Wderks
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated and has a kind of old classy feel to it. We had a great room with balcony on the 10th floor and time to enjoy the spa as well. Very friendly and helpful staff at the frnt desk. The only thing really to improve taking into account the quality-price offered now, would be that there isn't really a restaurant or roomservice (there are leaflets in the rooms for a pizza chain restaurant and a sushi place that both deliver in the hotel. On the other hand, with the hotel right on Gran Via, there are many places to eat closeby. Also from my travelling experiences, the cleaning service is one of the loudest I have ever heard, so the Sunday morning rest got cut a bit short. In general, very nice hotel to relax with the spa right there and close to all musical theatres and a lot of Madrid's nightlife

Reviews.Title: “A great city break hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Noreenfogarty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an example of a very good "city break" hotel from the point of view of location and price. It is situated in the Gran Via which forms part of the history of the city and the tour buses pass it. It is within easy walking distance of the most famous landmarks and the views from the roof are quite breathtaking! The jacuzzis on the roof were a wonderful way to relax after a day's sightseeing! There are plenty of bars and restaurants nearby and the Plaza Espana Metro station is only a stone's throw away and makes the airport easily and cheaply accessible.The rooms are sound-proofed which gives for a very good night's sleep! The staff were most helpful and accommodating. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the lovely city of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: bronz1inthekeys
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is exceptional! You are just across the street from Plaza Espana & it's metro stop. There is another metro stop one block in the opposite direction. You are within walking distance of the Palace, several gardens and botanical parks. Walking distance to Plaza Mayor, Puerte del Sol & the amazing Mercado de San Miguel! The rooms were very comfortable. Decor was fresh & modern. Our room had a small balcony which overlooked the Grand Via and MADRID.The windows also sealed out all the noise of the Grand Via, virtually silent. Comfortable beds. Nice bar in the lobby. Staff there accommodated our Wimbledon viewing wishes. Free in room mini bar was a nice touch. Hotel staff was charming and very helpful as well as kind...... then there is the spa! Several different temperatured jacuzzis, sauna, orange bath, stone river rock pool (great foot massage) even an ice flake machine as some people like to pack them selves in ice before or after various heat treatments. After several weeks of traipsing around Europe, then squeezing ALL of Madrid in before our return to the states, the spa was perfect for rejuvenating tired travelers. It also made for a better flight home. Hotel was reasonably priced, staff excellent, rooms comfortable, perfectly located and the spa was a BONUS. I would most definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend at Senator Gran Via Spa hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ellen-Mine
Reviews.Content: 3 adults should share 2 queen size beds, so no 3 had to sleep in the split between the beds. Even the hotel knew that we were 3 adults arriving, we had to ask for 3 duvets, 3 x glasses, cups etc. Friendly staff in the reception (especially a female staff member) who could help us with advice. No noise at the 6th floor even it was towards the busy street. Free soft drinks (water + Pepsi, - if you drink that!) in a fridge that didn't seem to work.You get free shampoo but no conditioner. The spa outdoors wasn't ready to use, - and the smell from clorine that met us in the reception when entering made us not wanting to go there.The room was clean but old-fasioned. The Internet was slow and it was impossible to get a print of our boarding-cards in the reception. We had to find out ourselves where to get it, as the man in the reception gave us a wrong advice. The hotel is easy to reach from the airport, - and easy to use the public transportation near by.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star quality”
Reviews.Author: hmbpaisley
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel for 3 nights. No complaints just a very run of the mill hotel. My room is a double for one person. The room is tiny. Tv needsupdated poor reception.Satellite tv only has news programmes in English. Glad I brought my kindle. Breakfast not worth 10 euros but convenient. Hotel is in a good location but I'm sure I could get better value elsewhere. Room clean but very basic bed linen. Needs better decor to make me think 4 star. Looks like a budget type decor. Makes me appreciate my home comforts. I have to say been travelling around a lot the last six months.first time I've preferred my own bedroom. Having read other reviews I'm sure there are rooms in hotel which might rate 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: JW1023
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Espana Hotel, and not the one called Gran Via. For some strange reason, both hotels are referred to as Senator Gran Via and we were dropped off at the Senator Gran Via, and not the Espana one. So we had to walk with our big luggages from the Gran Via to the Espana Hotel. I had the most disappointing time here. The receptionists are not helpful, and indifferent. They did not even have a trolley for the luggages. Moreover, when we asked them for help with shuttle service or taxi for transfer from the hotel to the train station, they had the most amazing reply - they said they can't book a taxi. Say what?! They said that we should just cross the street and hail a taxi. Thanks for the great customer service. So all 6 of us had to drag our big luggages (we are international tourists, so we had large luggages for our clothes) across the busy street to hail taxis for all of us. I don't understand why the hotel people can't help us with shuttle service or taxi-booking. Another incident that made me shake my head was when the card key of the husband of my sis-in-law wasn't working. So he went down to ask the receptionist to check the card. The guy said it worked fine, and then asked for the surname under whose name the room was registered, so the husband of my sis-in-law gave 3 surnames (since we were 3 parties traveling together). The receptionist said there was none in their database with that surname. What?! So how did we check-in? Of course, the receptionist started to doubt the identity of the husband of sis-in-law. Finally, my sis-in-law went down to show the ID of her husband. And then, inexplicably, the receptionist said that the name of the husband of my sis-in-law was in their computer. Say again?! Weird. Take note, this hotel is said to be rated as a 4-star hotel. Really? I doubt that. Never again shall I stay here. This experience sort of ruined my first time in Madrid. Hotels are supposed to be your home away from home and help you deal with the stress of traveling, but this hotel failed to do that.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, functional, NOT 4* Quality”
Reviews.Author: Nat B
Reviews.Content: Negatives: To start, we booked Kingsize room, we just had a standard double. We booked a non-smoking room, but there were ashtrays in our room. Very little toiletries on offer, just soap, comb and a combo hair/body shampoo. We had two teabags in our room, even though there were meant to be teas/coffees on offer - we had to ask for these. Mini bar is free - great! But you will have an allowance of two bottles of water, coke and orange juice and one beer. The beds are very hard and pillow about 2 inches thick - we asked for more pillows. The room temperature, we had it turned up to the max with the blowers on full blast, but the room was still only passable to sleep in (and you had to turn the blowers down to be able to sleep because of the noise). The spa - well, it is shut on Mondays as is the gym - this isn't noted on their website - it also doesn't tell you you have to pay to use it! Oh and it doesn't open until 12 noon on Tuesdays! Hotel overall was rather dated, the bar in the lobby is not overly welcoming, no place to sit and relax. The internet, you have to pay for. The TV, it's CRT monitors, very bad reception. There is a small "hifi" glued to the shelf where you can listent o the radio and play cassettes (does anyone still have them). There were no curtains to block out the street lighting in our room, there was a sheer-type curtain which I guess could be seen through I have travelled a lot and this doesn't live up to a 4* rating at all. Positives: The bedding and towels were clean as was the room overall. The staff, well, they were there, very jobswoth I feel, no real effort to provide you the best service they can, functional. Location, yes, very central for the sightseeing. Oh and there is a reasonable Starbucks just 100 yards walk away for a decent coffee/tea and muffin!

Reviews.Title: “very good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: keijo
Reviews.Content: stayed at senator espana for 3N on a conference trip in jan 12. perhaps due to the discounted(?) rate i was given a room facing the very small inner yard - i.e. no proper windows. so it was pretty dark all the time, quite a disappointment. however, the heating worked well (january) and there was hot water in the shower. walls are thin, woke up multiple times to people coming home late night. the free internet was throttled to 64kb/s or something, really a disgrace!! could not open two pages at the same time. using skype credit i could've paid for a proper service but 0,14€/min seemed a bit steep!! why are they doing this? perhaps they should consider charging for air and water too? breakfast was diverse and delicious - the best part of this place. a range of spanish cheeses and cold cuts plus all kinds of breads and stuff. definitely worth it. (to be fair: at least by the standards of an european living in asia and missing european breakfast :)) location seemed quite convenient, pretty much on top of plaza espana station, but then again i didn't venture out much. the "jamon museum" next door offered nice ham plates with a good value for money. the pizza place diagonally across the road was decent too.

Reviews.Title: “Senator Gran Via 70 (there are 2 hotels Senator in Gran Via!)”
Reviews.Author: Fenix83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend and we were 2 couples. The hotel has a great location (very close to the subway and generally is situated in the heart of Madrid). The room where very spacious, clean and well furnished. The staff has always been very helpful and our stay was just perfect! Value for money excellent. I have no negative pointsto mentioning, if a day I'll go back to Madrid I think I'll choose the same hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: froufrouMadrit
Reviews.Content: just ok! Friendly reception, average breakfast, and sad restaurant. Close to the center.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: terryCorkIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in a triple room. The mattresses were so hard that we could not get a good sleep. Very noisy room even on the 9th floor. Breakfast was good .Spa was a total rip off.€15 for the pleasure of sitting in an overcrowded jacuzzi. Hot tub on the roof was anything but hot.Bar in hotel was uncomfortable and not designed to make you linger. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anndeedee
Reviews.Content: Just come back yesterday from 3 nights b&b in this fabulous hotel in Madrid. We (3 couples) got just what we asked for, 3 double rooms front facing, close together, and they were lovely, clean spacious rooms with lashings of hot water for baths and showers and even though on the front the windows are so well sealed there is no noise from the traffic at all. Breakfasts were a very substantial continental with plenty of selections but also eggs, bacon or sausage was available on request from the waiters. The location was ideal for getting around and the hop on hop off guide bus, stops just a few metres away. Very close to the Plaza De Espana metro, so easy to get to from airport. we didn't get to the swimming pool due to lack of time on our behalf so cannot comment on that but the rest of the hotel was perfect. I would definately have no hesitation in going back to stay there if we ever go back to Madrid. One of the best hotels we have stayed in. Thank you to all the staff for a lovely hassle free break.

Reviews.Title: “Yes and No”
Reviews.Author: Shane S
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, but our room was tiny. And the television was very badly placed. Behind a door. Locationwise, it's perfect. Gran Via is always buzzing, and the other main Plazas are all within enjoyable walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Overall pretty decent. Need customer service training.”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaEd
Reviews.Content: We were in Madrid for World Youth Day and had 8 rooms for 8 nights to accomodate 16 of us. Overall the property is well kept. I liked the beds, although the mattress was probably a little firm for most. The rooftop jaczzi you'll see advertised on their site is cold water, not hot. I don't know if that's a European thing that I'm not aware of, but it seemed strange. Although this was August, some of our group was actually cold as they sat out there. They did make an accomdation for a last minute room switch to put 3 of us in 1 room and have one person solo, which was nice. The free mini-bar consists of 1 for each guest: non-alcoholic beer, small Pepsi, small bottle of water, and small orange juice. They did not replace these daily as expected, because we were "part of a group" I thought booking 64 nights with them seemed worth providing the drinks they advertised - so this was a disappointment. The front desk staff seem to have their hands tied about most issues. If the "person able to authorize" things isn't around (and many times was not) - they were strangely mechanical and of limited help with most requests. Just 20 minutes before boarding the bus to leave for the airport on the way home, someone stole one of our group's laptop right in the lobby. They have a video camera facing the front door, but said they could not look at it without a police report, which we tried to file but didn't have the time to wait for the police to arrive. This was one of those "do the right thing / common sense" issues that didn't take place as I would have expected. The breakfast buffet that was included with the room was high quality and fresh - meats, cheeses, juices, breads, pastries, fruit, cereals, etc. If you are given an option for meals inclusive when booking, I highly recommend this. We did not use the spa which was 2 floors below the street level. Rooms were dark when the curtains were pulled and it was quiet. Windows did a great job of blocking out the loud street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: msrw
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel as part of a group in July. Location: Brilliant. 2mins walk to the metro, also bus stop right outside the hotel. The hotel is on a main road but didn’t hear any noise from the room. Taxi from the airport took about 20 or so mins - cant remember how much it cost tho. Rooms: Stayed in a family room, two double beds pushed together. The room was huge, nice dressing table, table and chairs - more then enough space. The bathroom was pretty big too. Came with the normal amenities too. There was a roof top sun terrace with some sunloungers (about 8/10) and some table and chairs up there as well as 2 Jacuzzi's. Very good for sun bathing as it was 30' when we were out there. Great views of the city too. We spent some time in the bar by reception too, drinks were priced ok (Madrid seemed very pricy in general) bar staff were a good laugh too. Cant comment on the Spa as we didn’t use it. Overall I think this was a good choice of hotel, had no problems getting around and the room always seemed clean. Wouldn’t hesitate staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Peakhome
Reviews.Content: I found the staff friendly and helpful, especially when my purse was stolen while out shopping! Rooms were comfortable and quiet. Ours was at the back but with open aspect. Rooms and bathroom were clean. Bed was comfortable. The hotel was chosen because of it's proximity to the theatres but it is conveniently placed near the Metro also. I would return again in the future, especially on a theatre trip.

Reviews.Title: “Guests get in the way of the smooth running of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DouglasHauser
Reviews.Content: I would NOT recommend this hotel - not because of the slightly shabby decor, not because you have to pay for the spa (and book!!) - these things you can live with. But I would NOT recommend this hotel because of the 'no can do' attitude of the staff. It seems like the guests get in the way of the smooth running of this hotel. We wanted to change from one person to two people at check in - this was greeted with an accusatory 'But you booked for one. You should have booked for two' - We didn't mind at all paying extra but we were made to feel like we had done something wrong! The hotel was blatantly empty - it was a Sunday - and we wanted to extend our room for a late check out for a fee, as advertised on a big sign on the reception desk we were enquiring at. This was so we could spend the day in their spa - again at a fee. When we asked to do this, we were told no, it's not possible. We queried why, considering we were existing customers, the hotel seemed empty, and there was a sign encouraging us to do exactly that right there in front of us on the desk. They told us the hotel was fully booked and they needed the room. So I went onto their website, requested a room for that day, and was offered a full range of rooms. I told them this, and pointed out that it was a Sunday and the hotel was obviously empty, and they said that no, it was not possible to extend. So I asked if we could leave our bags and use the spa, and they immediately barked 'Have you booked? You have to book the spa and it is fully booked. I may be able to squeeze you in but there are no lockers left'. We were in Madrid to celebrate a birthday - we had one day there and wanted to spend it in the spa of the spa hotel we had booked into - and were unable to do so for an unexplained reason. I notice that someone from the hotel has repeatedly commented on the reviews, saying it's useful for them to improve their service and so on, but this is obviously just lip service as there seems to be no change at all in service levels - and it is always the same thing complained about. On the plus side, the beds were comfortable, they had free internet, and the room was quite big - but our stay was marred by the unpleasant "service".

Reviews.Title: “Eh.”
Reviews.Author: aurorabrchicago13
Reviews.Content: If you're arriving at 8 a.m. for a 2-week trip in Europe, you might want something a little more comfortable and centrally located. The accommodations were perfectly adequate and well priced. The reception desk was very friendly and helpful. But the room was...eh. Bed was hard like most in Europe, weird air conditioning. I picked Senator because I thought we'd have tons of places to visit at night. I've stayed in Puerta del Sol which had many more dining and entrainment options. We also stayed at the Maydrit Hotel near Barajas airport. Now, that's a great hotel. And it's about a minute walk from the metro. Stay there if you're looking for a reasonably priced and comfortable hotel. The Metro is way too easy to use to worry about being close to restaurants and sites.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: daniamsuarez
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in July 2010 for a stay in December 2010 and my credit card was charged immediately upon booking. When we arrived, exhausted from a very long overseas trip, we were told that they had no proof that we'd paid and wanted to charge us again! The man at the front desk, and the manager, basically said that I was claiming that I'd paid, but they could not prove that I had and therefore I was responsible for providing a receipt. Who carries a credit card statement with them, and besides, don't they have computers that they can check that through? They were extremely rude and unhelpful!!! The hotel is ok, but def not a 4-star. This was an extremely bad experience and I would recommend any other hotel over this one.

Reviews.Title: “Grand name with disappointing facilities”
Reviews.Author: opentrail
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks impressive and the staff at reception are pleasant enough speaking English as my Spanish is terrible. Had a room on the 10th floor street side with a private balcony. Of course in December the Sun streamed through the windows warming up the room but no way I was standing outside on the balcony in sub zero temperature. The windows provided good sound proofing however the number of police cars and ambulances running past with there sirens blasting out can still be heard in the room. So can the other guests in the corridor but I managed to sleep without the noise bothering me. The bed was terrible and woke up every morning with an aching back. There was no WiFi signal in my room and no cable to hook up to. In reception and in the corridors WiFi was "sometimes" available but did not consistently work. Very frustrating for business! Luckily I had my 3G Internet phone but I don't want to know what the bill is. Very disappointing. The Spa has to be booked in advanced as an optional extra, €9 and can be used for maximum 1 hour by either hotel guests or people off the street. The Turkish steam room had no steam and served mainly as a dark room. Various pools of cold and warm water but frankly the cold was luke warm and the warm was just that as opposed to Hot. The hotel advertised on a certain booking site as having a gym/fitness room. It didn't have one. Also annoying when you have made space in your suitcase to bring ones gym kit and then find out that there isn't one.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: SWDM
Reviews.Content: Very influenced with this hotel. Good position between buying localities and large assortment of shopping inside very simple walk distance. The 'ladies of the night' cited on other reconsiders offered no difficulties at all and the locality sensed flawlessly safe. Rooms here are a good size (though bathing room small) and with large outlooks of the GranVia -The free minibar was absolutely a plus. Staff very helpful and discreet - not anything too much trouble. Excellent morning buffet breakfast, alternative and nourishment very fresh. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Rudeness and ilegal practises”
Reviews.Author: icasal
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel coming from London to my home in Spain, i had to sleep 1 night in Madrid. Internet access wasn't working however it was advertised in the website. The room was smelly and the spa was closed!! I went to reception to find out what was going on since i had to send an important file for my job at 1 AM. I had to go out to a cyber-cafe and pay it myself in that dangerous area in Madrid at that time of the night, because they simply had no internet access for a Mac!! The following day in the morning they told me the spa was closed for being monday (that wasn't stated on the website either). So i asked for a "claim sheet", which is an official document issued by the regional government and all hotels from Madrid must have available for their customers, first the girl tried to cheat on me and give a "suggestion" sheet from the hotel, which is different and has no legal value, but i asked again for the sheet, and she gave it to me... But now try to believe this, when filling it they must write the hotel ID and seal on it, but she wrote some random numbers and false information, and left some other fields blank. I realized when i was back home in my own region (you know spain has different laws, she knew i couldn't claim later in my region), but since i was leaving for the airport i didnt check that data in the own hotel, i would have had to call the police if i had realized... That was by far the worst experience ever, later i tried to contact the hotel management to tell about that ilegal practices, but they never replied. Avoid at all cost, its expensive, rude staff, smelly bathrooms, spa is closed on random days so you might find yourself there paying for a spa service you dont have. Ridiculous. Avoid. IM still waiting for the management to contact me...

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: NZ_2urist
Reviews.Content: Senator Espana located right on Gran Via, close to all sights and action. Even though the hotel is dated and in need of renovation it has absolutely everything one might need or want. Spacious room and bathroom with a separate entry hall with huge wardrobe. and nicely set up desk. Tea-making facilities, your own ironing board and iron, fridge with complimentary water, juice and coke daily. Very clever lighting and even a small music/radio stereo system. Complimentary fresh fruits and cold water at the reception, complimentary sun bathing and spa facilities on the roof-terrace and 1.5 hours access to full spa with two sauna's in the basement. The TV set was really old and reception was very poor with only two channels in English (CNN & BBC) but as it was mentioned before the hotel is dated and this is reflected in a great price for such a prime location and numerous perks.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Perfect Location and The Most Comfortable Beds EVER!”
Reviews.Author: ara_nobilis
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights with my Mum, in mid-August of 2010. Firstly, the hotels locations is spot on, from the airport we got the metro to the Plaza de Espana station, took about 30 mins and only 1 change, once there the hotel was right in front of us, literally about 50 yards away. SO easy to get to, and the metro is only 2 euros each, much better then a 25 euro taxi. Once there, the staff were polite and helpful, and the lobby very welcoming. Our room was on the 7th floor, quick and efficient lifts in the hotel so no problem at all. The room itself was spotlessly clean, very spacious and had the most comfortable reclining beds I have ever slept in. Although the road that the hotel is on is quite busy the triple glazed windows kept the noise out. The airconditioning was also easy to use and had a good range of tempuratures ie. didn't wake up in the middle of the night frozen. We had bathroom freebie's such as comb, soap, shampoo, shoe polish, nail file etc, plus a FREE minibar!! Amazing! During the day we walked to every major tourist spot from the hotel, Retiro Park, Royal Palace, Reina Sophia, Prado, Plaza Mayor, The Rastro etc etc. If you don't like walking the metro is easy, clean and very cheap, with the station right outside the hotel. We chose to have our room without breakfast as it seemed quite expensive, which I still think was a good choice as there are some lovely little cafes very close to the hotel, which are far cheaper and far more cultural. We also paid a visit to the Spa in the hotel, which was really nice, decorated in a cave style and had sauna, steam room, jacuzzi, swimming pool, showers, foot baths plus a selection of random pools such as one with oranges floating in it!? It did smell lovely though! Make sure you check out the jacuzzi's on the rooftop aswell! Free to use and an excellent view over Madrid, including the Royal Palace. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel, and will certainly stay there again if I ever visit Madrid again. To summerise: GOOD POINTS -Best possible location and easy to get to -Very clean, comfortable and quiet -Helpful staff -Free minibar -Jacuzzi on the roof perfect for a spot of sunbathing as there are no beaches! BAD POINTS -Expensive breakfast -Room gadgets such as kettle and TV were quite old and basic, but who goes on holiday to watch TV and drink tea?? Hope this helps :)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor room quality”
Reviews.Author: samnittraveler
Reviews.Content: Apart from the location, everything else was below standard for a 4 star hotel. The room was dirty. The floor was chipped. The bed had old linen. This room is in desperate need of renovation. Bathroom was OK. This is more like a 2 star hotel. The room was quiet inspite of being on a very busy street.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location...Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jevoIbiza
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a one-night stop-over in Madrid for a connecting flight the following morning. Got a good price online and hoped it would be a good place to spend some hours exploring Madrid. Hotel is in an excellent location, directly on the Grand Via, which is the principle High/Main Street and roughly 15 min drive form the airport. Hotel exterior is outdated and in need of refurbishment. Reception Ok, room terrible, a shoe-box with no window (just a large mirror) and dirty linen. VERY POOR for a 4-Star Hotel. Was hoping to use the gym but informed that it was closed and only opens from 12pm - 8pm, which for any normal traveler is a seriously limited window of opportunity. The Spa was also an additional charge service, but as I didn't get to see it cant comment on it. Bad Hotel from the normally reliable Senator Chain......

Reviews.Title: “Great spa, good location but noisy.”
Reviews.Author: ClintBolton
Reviews.Content: Ask for a room at the back of the hotel - the front overlooks Madrid's biggest and busiest road and the hotel has poor sound proofing. Emergency vehicles up and down the street all night. Much quieter at the back. The spa is well worth paying extra for - one of the best i have been in. Not the plushest hotel i've stayed in but pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but otherwise very average...”
Reviews.Author: Seascale
Reviews.Content: Well situated hotel on the Gran Via, about equidistant from the shops and the nightlife. Apart from a strange aroma in the corridors that we couldn't quite place (not terrible but certainly not pleasant) this is a truly unremarkable hotel - average rooms, reasonably friendly reception, OK value for money. We were on a "cultural" trip (i.e. p**s up - for which Madrid itself is highly recommended) and spent probably less than 10 hours in the hotel over the course of a weekend... so it did the job.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Stuartjohn24
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week while on business. I noticed some people complaining about the lobby!? I thought most of the time you would actually be in the room!? personally I found the lobby to be clean and very respectable. The rooms are of a very decent size, clean and well equipped with free minibar replenished daily, electric reclining beds, solid wood furniture, TV, Hi-Fi and double glazing/sound proofing etc... (I worked nights and found this to be ideal!) I have stayed in a couple of other hotels recent that are very local on Gran Via and they were terrible, I wont mention the names! I would also like to note the Wifi is free too and very reliable. I would seriously recommend this hotel, its great value compared to other hotels locally with much better services, cleanliness and overall appeal, I paid around 80 euros a night here and the other hotel i wont mention was nearer 160 euros which I found quite shocking! To add a note to that the lobby was very nice, as soon as you entered the lifts the state of the hotel was quickly realised, DONT judge a hotel by its lobby!

Reviews.Title: “What an absolute nightmare!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jamesinmadrid
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel recently and to be honest, we were basically disgusted. First we found two cockroaches in our room. Then, we had a maid come in to get rid of it. When she arrived, it was clear she had the flu as she was red eyed and sneezing alot(without hold her hand on her mouth). We thought that we were just unlucky until we were dining in the hotel that night. We each had a salad and each found a hair in the respective salads. I thought we were on candid camera. We pointed this out to the waiter, who, without even reply to our remark about the hairs, promptly lifted our plates with a sigh and returned to the kitchen. A full twnty five minutes later, a different waiter, but eaqually surly, returned with new salads. The food was tasteless and poorly presented. The service was dire. One day when we were leaving in our room key to reception before we left for a walk, we overheard a conversation between the manager and a woman. The woman had evidently received a gift of a vocher to use the spa and treatment rooms. but becasue she was pregnant, she couldn´t use the voucher for almost a year. The time limit on the voucher had lapsed but the manager wouldn´t let her use it. How mean it that!!!!!! It wouldn´t even cost them anything to let her use the damn spa. This moment just summed up the hotel for us. We will never darken its door again and we recommend that you don´t heed the positive reviews on this site as they are clearly written by the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel. would defintly go back if ever in Madrid again”
Reviews.Author: deelyla
Reviews.Content: i booked this as a surprise weekend away with my boyfriends. as it was a surprise i was a tad aprehensive that it was going to be a let down, however it did not disapoint what so ever. the lobby itself is very welcoming with very friendly staff. the room itself was absolutely spotless! the only thing is the size of the room. a little snug. but to be honest this was not a big deal. very clean. a good sized bed (with remote recline!), lovely bathroom. breakfast was also lovely. a great selection of hot and cold drinks, bread pastries, cheese, ham etc etc. location was fab - right on the gran via. if you're only in madrid for a short while like we were then this location is perfect. lots of nice restaurants nearby and only a short rail journey to real madrids stadium. all tourist attraction sites are nearby also. the spa in the hotel is amazing! we went twice it was so good. lovely and relaxing. this price is not included in the room charge, which i think it should be. but it's defintly worth going! i say an all over great hotel. i would defintly go back if staying in madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Steph_Peter_20
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in July 2007 and I am only writing a review now. I cannot believe it is now so far down the recommendations! When we stayed here we found the hotel to be brilliant, it was clean, the beds were great (reclining). I see that people have had items stolen, however we never seen any of this and always felt safe. The Spa was great and very relaxing. Hope this review is not out of date!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel ...great location”
Reviews.Author: shelbygt500
Reviews.Content: Since this was our first trip to Spain, ( small town canadian folk)we were alittle unsure of what to expect. After searching the internet using hotels.com for days I finally booked at the senator espana spa hotel. I'm glad I did.... It has such a great location within minutes usually under 10mins. in any direction you were at an important attractions. (walking distance). The lobby is small but quaint.. We had a room with twin beds that pushed together. The room it self was somewhat small but very clean, modern, and cleaned everyday like clockwork. Satelite TV, internet that worked from your laptop or off the TV., free mini bar re -stocked daily, .everything it says in the hotel add it has. The spa is interesting. The people at the front desk were very helpful and friendly, very willing to show us how to get around, make reservations for shows. We stayed here for 5 nights, we were not disappointed...I felt very comfortable walking around madrid,as did my daughter.. It was a wonderful mother/daughter get away. The spanish people seemed atleast to us very friendly and pleasant. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel on our next visit..Thank you and Enjoy....

Reviews.Title: “Interior rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mary_Staple
Reviews.Content: Good location, great breakfast with loads of choice of fruits, cheeses and meat. Room was small but clean and comfortable. The electric beds were cool, free mini bar a nice touch. We had an interior room, which had virtually no natural light. If you are going to be out all day and are just going to use the room to sleep in, the room will be fine as at least the sun won't wake you up! Some might find it a little claustrophobic. The bar area was nothing special, no sofas. If you stay here, have a last drink over the road in the Emperador, a much grander hotel, with a very comfortable bar area and great service. You'll get nuts and olives with your drink too, unlike the bar in the Senator.

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop Jucuzzis!”
Reviews.Author: meg3oo
Reviews.Content: just returned from 3 night break, this hotel excellent. staff really helpful, food varied and plentiful. My 7 and 9 year old thought the rooftop jucuzzis amazing! fantastic views of madrid, including the royal palace while you chill.rooms not that spacious( we had one with 2 double beds) but useable, window opened onto the Gran Via, but no trouble with noise due to good double glazing.would definately visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Quick stop”
Reviews.Author: Badutten
Reviews.Content: On our way to St. thomas in the Carribean, we stayed one nigth here and ate in the restaurant. Perfect dinner (Paella) an very lovely hotel. A class better than average.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Cbarny9
Reviews.Content: A good clean hotel, we had a spacious twin room with twin double beds, roomy bathroom, good shower, in room fridge stocked with fruit juices, soft drinks and beers. Sound proofing was very good for a main road location as long as the window closed. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice, continental with many meats and cheeses. Reception staff were always friendly and helpful. Hot tub on roof was a novelty as was the turkish baths spa, good fun tho a little shabby in places. Look out for the bath full of oranges!! Access to internet was available in reception for 1 euro and internet was avaialble in room. Bus tour stop was right outside the hotel, line 1 very interesting but line 2 a little boring apart from Real Madrid stadium and I am not a football fan either! Espana Plaza was 5 minutes walk and the Palace only 10 minutes walk. Madrid itself was not quite as expected and we found people reluctant to use English which caused us problems on occasions. As in England recommended restaurants and bars were difficult to get into without reservation or speaking Spanish! Taxis proved very difficult on Saturday evening similar to other cities. There were some very seedy areas and some very nice areas. Santa Ana/Santa Domingo area/Casa Baja areas all good for cafe bars/tapas bars, outdoor seating etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Hellyblue
Reviews.Content: I would recommend the Senator Espana to anyone travelling to Madrid. The location was perfect, the staff were friendly and helpful and the bedrooms were fabulous! We contacted the hotel prior to arrival to arrange a room with a view of the Gran Via which was ready on arrival. Unfortunately the hotel system wasn't working and we were originally sent to an occupied room but this was quickly corrected and the staff could not apologise enough. Breakfast was good although we weren't offered tea or coffee, I think you have to ask for it rather than be asked. We had a free voucher for the spa which was nice after a lot of sightseeing but the facilities are pretty much just your standard hotel swimming pool, jacuzzi, sauna and steam room so wouldn't have paid for it. The bedrooms are amazing, spacious, clean and the power shower was fab. The free mini bar was a great touch and just what was needed when you get back to your room at various points. Overall I would definately use this hotel again and would recommend it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Lindylu_007
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from a 4 night stay at the Senator Espana and had a great stay. There were some pros and cons which I'll detail here. CONS first - get the bad stuff out of the way! Although 4 star rated I don't think it really is compared to other hotels I've been in. The room is definitely 4 star but the rest of the amenities, reception, breakfast area, reception were more of a 3 star standard. The breakfast area is in the basement and the hotel is busy so it's very rushed - reminded me of the package hotels you go on for holidays with all the bustling and mad rushing around of the waiters, complete with quickly depleted buffet and the noise of banging plates and crashing cutlery. The buffet selection however is very good, but you probably need to be there before 9am. I needed access to internet & printer to print off my boarding card for my return flight and the reception staff were very unaccommodating at first when I asked where I could do this, both the afternoon shift and night shift, till eventually through sheer persistence on my part I finally got told to contact the front desk manager in the morning, which I did and all worked out okay - see Pros list for more detail. Aqua Spa definitely not worth €18 pp but if going on a Sunday it's 1/2 price and then it's an okay price to pay IMO. PROS: The hotel was very accommodating in that although I booked through a website and not directly with the hotel, I emailed the hotel explaining my husband & I were celebrating a special occasion and could we have a room on a high floor with a view..... which they gave us - admittedly the view wasn't much, but they also gave us a complimentary bottle of bubbly and fruit bowl!! The rooms are great with spacious bathrooms, power shower, as another reviewer said, tons of stuff and they're not stingy with it either. Reclining beds are just the thing! and the rooms really are soundproofed - and I'm a light sleeper! Free minibar - wide selection of soft drinks and 2 beers, restocked every day, which is great, also had tea & coffee - just what you need after a day of sightseeing. Location is brilliant, lots of restaurants within walking distance for the evening and metro station 30secs away. The Front Desk Manager, Monica was very helpful. I asked her if I could print out my boarding card and it wasn't a problem at all - and I was expecting the worst after the attitude I'd had the previous day! We had to wait a bit and she even offered to get me coffee while I waited. All in all I would recommend the hotel for location and the rooms itself, but as I said earlier, don't expect much in the way of reception area etc.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be positive about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: laser100
Reviews.Content: Talk about disappointed!For the money we spent on this hotel we were not happy.The lobby & bar area are not very welcoming. The 1st room we were assigned was pokey, small with 1 curtain that didn't cover the window.The reclining beds did not work.I asked if it was much trouble to change room - the Reception staff were helpful but the 2nd room was not much bigger & had absolutely no air. The air conditioning didn't seem to work either.The spa is a bit of a joke.We got it for half price as it was Sunday but only spent about half an hour in it as it's a bit overrated (even for 9eur per person-thank god we hadn't forked out 18eur that it normally costs).Breakfast was good-very fresh and good variety.The hotel location is fine & there's a great restaurant next door (De Mario's I think it's called).If I was visiting Madrid again I wouldn't bother with this Hotel...there has to be something a little classier for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Mary014
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in Madrid at this hotel and it ws great. Yes as some of the other reviews suggest our room was small, but that was such a minor thing. We have been to Madrid many times and this has to be one of the best. Great location, great breakfast and a nice free mini bar in the room. We also used the lovely spa which was half price on a Sunday for 1.5 hours. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but the room ! Small pokey.!”
Reviews.Author: Cleops2001
Reviews.Content: I am just back from a 4 day break in Madrid and I stayed in the Senator Espana. The hotel itself was lovely friendly staff, rooms very clean and well equiped in every way. Free mini bar in the room too which is fab and restocked every morning by housekeeping. One fault was that our room was quite small and very warm at times, there was airconditioning and a fan but our window was facing into the building, there are 12 floors total and there is a hollow in centre of the hotel from bottom to top, and our window faced into this but it is enclosed so no real fresh air as such. That was the only fault, had a great time and would recommend this hotel, just specify if you can what room you would like.!!! The porters lovely and very helpful.!

Reviews.Title: “Very well equipped hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elgordo38
Reviews.Content: Our best hotel experience in Spain. The room was a good size with every possible requirement provided - even tea and coffee making facilities. Staff were friendly and helpful and breakfast was high quality and plentiful. Can certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “40th Brithday”
Reviews.Author: schmacher
Reviews.Content: Date 28th Oct - 31st Oct Went to Madrid for my 40h Brithday for 3 nights,organised a tripfor 14 of us. Went on Trip Advisor to choose the hotel. The Spa Senator Espana is a must, an Excellent Hotel just in the right place. Within Walking Distance of all the main attractions. My Wife and I had a room on the 10th Floor with a balcony over looking the city, what can I say. The hotel has excellent rooms, ther was nobody in our party who was disappointed. The breakfast is very good and plenty of choice. The SPA facilities are good, but will cost you 18euros each. I will be staying here again that is for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: scouse1990
Reviews.Content: Firstly apologies - we actually stayed in this hotel at the end of July but it was only now I had the thought of writing a quick review. The hotel is situated on the Gran Via towards the Plaza Espana and within 20 mins walk of pretty much everywhere worth seeing in Madrid. My wife is quite a light sleeper so booking a hotel with good sound proofing was the main priority - I spent 3 weeks searching, printing, listing and discarding!!! So it was with some trepidation that I entered the hotel on the Sunday. Unjustified trepidation. The staff were wonderful, the rooms very comfortable - wireless internet connection, free mini bar (extremely handy this turned out to be - nothing better than getting a cold drink out of the fridge at 4 in the morning), adjustable bed, great air conditioning, huge selection for breakfast etc. Price was very competititive and I would definitely recommend it. Our room was on floor 9 and we didnt hear a sound all week. Madrid itself was wonderful - we spent a night at the amusement park (which was 4 stops on the metro) which I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: LJ1
Reviews.Content: We ended up in the Senator Espana by mistake - we originally booked the Senator Gran Via but something went wrong and we ended up in its sister hotel. Anyway, this is a sound hotel with a good location on the Gran Via and close to the metro. The rooms are well-equipped with air con, remote controlled beds, good bathrooms etc. We were on the 1st floor overlooking the Gran Via but the room was well soundproofed so the traffic noise didn't disturb us. We thought the rooms were excellent value for money for central Madrid. It is worth looking for a rate with breakfast included as it is well worth having - a huge buffet. I'd certainly be happy ot stay here again.
